abstract: If all goes well, Evan Goldberg will have come a long way from the overcrowded Silicon Valley apartment that served as NetSuite’s first office nearly 10 years ago.
snippet: If all goes well, Evan Goldberg will have come a long way from the overcrowded Silicon Valley apartment that served as NetSuite’s first office nearly 10 years ago.
lead_paragraph: SAN MATEO, Calif.  If the initial public offering for NetSuite shares goes as planned later this week, Evan Goldberg will have come a long way from the overcrowded Silicon Valley apartment that served as the company’s first office nearly 10 years ago.

headline.main: Going Public Caps Dream for a Maker of Software
headline.print_headline: Going Public Caps Dream For a Maker Of Software
